description.en:
The South African Revenue Service (SARS) is South Africaâ€™s tax collecting authority. They are responsible for the following main tax types: Personal Income Tax, Corporate Income Tax (CIT), Value Added Tax (VAT), Pay As Your Earn (PAYE) [1]. A full list of different tax types can be found on the referenced website.

This registrar covers individuals as well as businesses such as public and private companies, co-operatives, universities, trusts, governments and embassies.

Individuals receive a unique Income Tax Number. Org-id does not recommend using the Income Tax Number of an individual person as a unique identifier.

Businesses can receive multiple tax numbers such as CIT, VAT, PAYE etc. [3] The Corporate Income Tax (CIT) is a tax imposed on companies resident in the Republic of South Africa and this is the preferred identifier to be used for a business.

[1]. https://www.sars.gov.za/types-of-tax/ 
[2]. https://www.sars.gov.za/businesses-and-employers/
[3]. https://www.sars.gov.za/businesses-and-employers/

access.guidanceOnLocatingIds: Ask the organisation you wish to identify to provide it's tax number.
